title: Transformers: The Movie (1986) 720p iTunes
description:
Transformers: The Movie (1986)

DESCRIPTION:
As their war with the evil Decepticons takes its greatest toll, the Autobots must stop Unicron, a planet-sized transformer out to destroy the only thing that can defeat it: the Autobot Matrix of Leadership. (with 2 audio commentaries)

SPECS IN BRIEF:
M4V file for iTunes/iDevices
V: 1280x720 23.98 fps h.264 @ ~3080 Kbps
A: 160 Kbps 2.0 AAC & 384 Kbps 5.1 AC-3 / 96 Kbps 2.0 AAC (2 commentaries)
S: English & English SDH

SOURCES:
The Transformers The Movie 1986 1080p BluRay x264-hV
Retail 20th Anniversary Edition DVD (commentaries & subs)

A FEW WORDS ABOUT THIS ENCODE:
While the video bit rate on this file is pretty high (at least by my encoding standards), DO NOT expect a pristine, reference-quality image-- this film was not restored prior to Blu-ray release. If you click on the screenshots, you'll see that the film betrays its age (25+ years) and low-budget origin with dust, hairs, and rough line work. This is the best it's EVER looked, but don't expect Lion King-like video quality.

There are 2 commentaries tracks: one with director Nelson Shin, writer Flint Dille and voice actor Susan Blu; another with a group of fans assembled by Hasbro.

PLAYBACK:
Encoded & tagged for iTunes and Apple devices (iPad, iPhone 4, etc) that can handle HD video, including *both* versions of the AppleTV set top box.
